poem:
"Upon Denali's Lone Climber"

A climber's dream,
traversing Denali alone,
ruptured into finality -
a descent, a rock-skinned tumble
into the alabaster silence.

Summer peaks awaken - a Scythian note
dowsed in Arctic shadows.
Park officials, solemn, lean into the
wind's terse retort, an echo.

Beneath the ruthless sun,
a timbre of ambition thaws
along the mountain's shivering spine -
Hope dies colder than the climb.
